fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1841].
  {panel}

At the moment there are only two permission levels for Portfolio plans: editor and viewer.

A common use-case for us is that users want to be able to view the latest version of the plan based on changes they've made in the backlog/s, but are unable to see or hit the (re-)calculate button because they only have view rights.

They don't want to change anything in the plan, so don't have edit rights, they just want to see the latest version. Therefore it would be very useful to have a third permission option which is exactly the same as the View permission level but with the ability to hit 'calculate'.

An alternative solution for us would be to implement JPO-1523 (automatic recalculate option).
fields.summary: Plan level permission to view and (re-)calculate only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1600].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When Subtask has dependency on other Subtask, its parent (Story) will display below error message:
- Cyclic dependency detected.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Allow Subtask to have dependency to other Subtask.
fields.summary: Allow Subtask to have dependency to other Subtask

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have ended support for IE11 on *31 March 2020*.

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.
{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11
Allow setting an import date for Agile Board data sources for Live Plans
Modify portfolio structure
Rename JIRA Portfolio to Portfolio for JIRA
Make Parent Link searchable via JQL
Remove mentioning stages in the maximum assignees per story configuration option for Live Plans

fields.description:
Portfolio's issue selection currently works slightly differently in the plan setup wizard than it does in the scope table of a plan.

In the setup wizard, it is possible to keep a parent selected even when all its children are deselected; this allows customers to only include the parent in the plan but not its children.

In the scope table of a plan, deselecting all children also deselects their parent. That is, customers cannot just exclude the parent but keep the children and they cannot exclude all children but keep the parent because selecting all children will also select the parent.

In order to allow for more control over what issues are selected, a quad-state checkbox is required that caters for the following scenarios:
# I want to select the parent, but none of its children
# I want to select the parent and some or all of its children
# I do not want to select the parent, but some or all of its children
# I want to select neither the parent nor its children
fields.summary: As a Portfolio user, I want to have more control over which issues are selected in plan setup and scope table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1452].
  {panel}

Hello,

I have a small suggestion. 
In this current version of Live Plans if the user do not create his Live Plan with the right board/projects since the very first plan creation, is not possible to have associated the team directly with the board-source added in a second time, modifying the plan. 
I understand you do not want to automatically erase uncient teams as probably the user could want to keep them, which I totally agree.
Besides, I am currently obliged to create manually any team for any board/project-source added after the first creation and this lead us to loose the great advantage of Live Plans (linking the team/source-board directly to the JIRA board information of the team/board, such as velocity).
May you kindly considerate to include this small improvement please?
Thank you very much!
fields.summary: Link team/source-board directly to the JIRA board information at any time after first Plan Creation

h3. Problem Description

Portfolio doesn't currently have a report to track Team Absence and Exception. This requires extra effort to extract this information and it would be great if Portfolio has such report.

fields.description:
Currently if two releases have the same date, only 1 will be displayed on the timeline. Even the tooltip for the single dot does not include information about any other nearby releases.

An easy solution i support would be when the tooltip is generated, search for all other releases with a date that is the same and append it to the tooltip. If i understand correctly the release dates are always at the end of a sprint, so the dates will match exactly you shouldn't even need to do a 'nearby dates' to cater for overlapping dots etc.
fields.summary: Display both releases on timeline if they have the same date

* Miss-click when creating issue

Hi there!

I would see the  necessity of having the  ability to export the portfolio dependencies report into an excel file (xls, cvs), so that I could generate custom dependencies reports.

 I'm currently working with Cloud version, however it would be nice to keep the functionality in both sides (Server, Cloud)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1474].
  {panel}

Hello,
While implementing Live Plan, you took the assumption that all your users want to commit scenarios to JIRA; this is not the case :(
Indeed, my Portfolio users (PMO and some scrum masters/POs) want to use Portfolio as sand box to generate bunch of scenarios. They want to undo changes and baseline scenarios and come back later to compare with other scenarios.
The fact you have merged the commit to JIRA feature within the same process makes it very hazardous to use. Indeed, if I want to baseline a scenario without committing anything in JIRA, the existing dialog is not appropriate; for that reason, we are not able to recommend Live Plan and stick for now to Classic Plan.
Regards.
fields.summary: Differentiate scenario undo/baselining from commit to JIRA

fields.description:

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, a JIRA Portfolio user won't see the global overview whenever there are custom sprints defined, even though the sprints have the same start and end dates across all teams. 

h5. Suggestion
As long as the start and end dates of all sprints match up, JIRA Portfolio could compute the overview view, and avoid using the individual sprint names, though, as they might be different for different teams.
fields.summary: Allow custom sprints to appear on Global Overview

fields.description:

As a product owner, I would like to be able to quickly make changes to the scheduling of stories in sprints to save time as compared to finding the issue in the tabular view and changing the sprint from the dropdown menu.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1405].
  {panel}

*Problem*
When issues are _Done_, that is, they are assigned to a status of the done category, they should show up in Live Plans when the respective _Completion date_ filter is set. However, this filter relies on the issues having a resolution and a resolution date, because it is date-based (it shows all issues that were completed since the beginning of the active sprint / month / quarter etc.). Thus, issues that are _Done_ but don't have a resolution are not picked up by this filter.

*Suggestion* 
To address this problem, an "All" option should be added to this filter that will pick up all completed issues regardless of their resolution date.

*Workaround*
The only way to work around this for now is to adapt the work-flow and treat statuses without a resolution not as _Done_ but still as _In Progress_, otherwise these issues will never show up in Live Plans
fields.summary: Add "Show all completed issues" option to Completion date filter in Live Plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-533].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, _Originally Planned_ estimation will be synchronized with _Estimate_ in JIRA Portfolio. Thus, when _Estimate_ value gets changed, it will change _Originally Planned_ estimation. This way, user does not have the option to preserve and keep it as the reference.

h5. Suggested Solution
This would be great to have option to preserve the _Originally Planned_ estimation. This way, user has the option to refer back to the initial estimation, perhaps for performance evaluation for the next plan.
fields.summary: Have the option to preserve the Originally Planned estimation

fields.description:

h3. Problem Description

As a user, I have the following requirements:
# Product Manager create Initiative, Epic and Stories (under project A) in a plan 
# I have 3 teams working on 3 different project and board (Project B -> Board One, Project C -> Board Two, Project D -> Board Three)
# Once PM creates the Initiatives, Epic and Stories, I wish to assign it to 3 different team accordingly. However, this isn't possible without going to each issue in JIRA as Portfolio doesn't have a feature to move a ticket to another project within a plan.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to move issues to another project within plan

As a Portfolio administrator, I would like to customize the default scope filter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1574].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in portfolio overbooked work is distributed as evenly as possible over all the people in the team that have the skills to do them. However, this could cause confusion as in JIRA the assignee is some else compared to portfolio

h3. Suggested Solution
Give users the option to either strictly follow the assignee or once Portfolio recognizes overbooked work, it immediate asks the user to change the assignee in JIRA.
fields.summary: As a user, I want Portfolio to intelligently handle assignee when overbooked work

fields.description: As a Portfolio user, I would like to have a scope filter to filter issues by the target date.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1301].
  {panel}

It will be good if these two menu items under Plan in Portfolio are hidden under the Configure Menu.
- Apply Updates to Projects
- Update from date

And the Configure menu is available to admins only. There is no safety mechanism here or a way to undo changes if someone erroneously run an update and the settings are not what we want it to be.

When creating epics in bulk, have option to assign to an existing project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1761].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When user clicks _Calculate_ button, Portfolio will get the latest update from JIRA and optimize the plan by automatically assigning Team, releases, etc. As a user, I want to plan my own Sprint, Releases, Team, etc.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to rollback/revert changes after user click Calculate. Or, provide a feature to stop Portfolio from auto assigning/adding Sprint, Team, Releases, etc.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to rollback/revert changes after user click Calculate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1883].
  {panel}

Hi,

I have the following Hierarchy in portfolio.

Theme  -> Initiative -> Epic ->Story

The Theme issue type has a custom field by which I want to query the Initiatives, Epics and Stories within the Theme that has a particular value for the custom field. Is this currently possible?

Roll-up Custom Field Values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1497].
  {panel}

*Problem*
Sprint end dates are mapped to the end of a day within Portfolio. That is, if there is a sprint ending on 15/Jun/16, 11:23:17, Portfolio will map its end date to 15/Jun/16, 23:59:59. Similar, sprint start dates are mapped to the beginning of the respective day. This is due to Portfolio scheduling on a day-granularity and hence timestamps have to be mapped to either the start or end of a day. As a consequence, the duration of that sprint might appear longer by one day than it actually is. For instance, a sprint running from 15/Jun/16, 11:23:17 - 16/Jun/16, 11:23:16 would have a duration of 2 days in Portfolio even though its actual duration is just one day. This leads to an inflated capacity for that sprint.

*Expected behaviour*
The sprint duration should be accurate, however, due to Portfolio's day granularity, the sprint start/end timestamps cannot be matched, a better heuristic might help (mapping timestamps from the afternoon to end-of-day, mapping timestamps from before noon to beginning-of-day).
fields.summary: Improve start and end date handling of Agile sprints in Live Plans
integrate portfolio and team calendar with computer calendar
Customize View For Plans For All Users
Allow editing of Plan Name and Description after creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As of now, there is no way to configure the _Issue Details View_ in Portfolio plan.
*  !image-2018-06-07-23-16-12-681.png|thumbnail! 

As a user, I'd like a feature to configure it so that I can add more fields.

h3. Suggested Resolution 

Provide ability to configure _Issue Details view_ in Scope tab.
fields.summary: Ability to configure Issue Details view in Portfolio plan
Provide notification and documentation about the change made to the value returned by the Portfolio's fields available publicly via the JIRA issue's endpoint of the JIRA Cloud REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1756].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Portfolio calculates whether a release is overbooked or not by using the issues scheduled for that sprint. As such, when a release is done within a sprint period, the release shows as _Overbooked_ as issues are scheduled for the whole period of the sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Releases to be re-calculated when it is done within a sprint period.

h3. Why this is important
When releases are done within a sprint, users would be able to see that the _Release_ is not overbooked when it is calculated based on capacity.
fields.summary: Re-calculate releases using capacity if it falls within a sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1861].
  {panel}

I've got a portfolio board which has been tuned, by slicing and dicing against releases, and adjusting the relative order of the Initiatives and Epics.

The schedule now shows that story A is before story B - but in my Kanban board that isn't the case.

Is there a way of rewriting the relative ranks of everything in the portfolio plan, so that the ranking of stories now matches what the plan has scheduled?

Without that our team can't work on stories in priority order from their Kanban boards. :(.

Amy I missing something?
fields.summary: Burning a portfolio plan back into the rank so that Kanban boards are synced.

fields.description: When issues are created inline on the backlog of a board that references a particular team in its filter that team should automatically be set on the issue to ensure it remains visible on the board. This behaviour already exists for labels and components but is currently missing for the team custom field.
fields.summary: Automatically set field "Team" on issues when created in backlog that references a specific team in its filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1619].
{panel}
In Portfolio Live Plans in the Shedule report it is very hard to do planning when all everything is the same color.

In the old Portfolio it was in Reports possible to set Coloring on Streams, Stages and Themes. I uses this daily when doing prioritization between multiple project deliveries competing for the same resources.

In Portfolio Live Plans it is only possible to set Coloring to Single or Theme. I would like to be able to set the Coloring on:

1) higher hierarchy levels, e.g. initiative.

2) Versions = Releases

3) Projects

This missing feature is at present blocking us in moving from the old Portfolio to Porfolio 2..0.
fields.summary: Portfolio Live Plans: Reports coloring of more than Single and Theme
Parent link and Epic link JQL should not be case sensitive
Sorting for different columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1449].
  {panel}

*Context*
My live plan is sourced from filters or boards that use some JIRA fields (i.e. components) to retrieve and select items.

*Where does my problem turn up*
After committing to JIRA an issue originally created in my plan, I notice that the issue disappears from my plan, neither my JIRA board shows it. Of course this happens because key fields of my filter/board filter couldn't be specified in the issue creation in JIRA, so that issue is no longer retrieved.

*What is the improvement about*
It would be important that +the button "+Create Story" let me specify these additional fields+.

Even better, +it could request a "source"+ among those currently configured in the plan, +and replicate what the JIRA board already does when you hit the "+create issue"+ button (see screenshot), that is sets attributes that can be inferred from the board filter.
fields.summary: Setting JIRA fields when committing issues created in live plans

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As of now, projects are listed by ID order in the portfolio plan. The team list is based on alphabetical order so it will be great if the project list follows the same behavior as well for consistency sake and also for the ease of finding the desired projects.

Properly arranged team based on alphabetical order
!Teams aligned.png|thumbnail! 


Projects not grouped alphabetically
 !projects messy.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project list filter in Portfolio plan should be alphabetically grouped like the team list for easier sorting

fields.description:
h3. Description
As a user, I'd like to have the access shortcut for Portfolio available at any screen by default.

Currently, I can access Portfolio only if I go back to Jira initial page, there is no shortcut if I'm inside a project or viewing an issue.

h3. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/project-shortcuts-765593117.html
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the access shortcut for Portfolio available at any screen
Creation Plan should allow to select a shared team

fields.description:
Deleting a cross-project release and keeping related releases keeps the CPR tag in individual cards.
This cause a misleading as those releases are displayed as a CPR.

When deleting a cross-project release, the CPR tag should be removed for the related releases.

h3. Notes

This is only applicable when using the old planning interface aka Portfolio 2. As a workaround, you can enable the new planning interface or exclude the Release from the Plan to re-configure the Issue sources to add back the releases.
fields.summary: Deleting a cross project release and keeping related releases keeps the CPR tag in individual cards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1465].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA Portfolio is not able to integrate with some of the popular third-party plugin such as Structure plugin, script runner and etc. Some the feature in these plugins such as islinkissueof, linkrecursive, etc... is useful to integrate with JIRA Portfolio when is comes to hierarchy representation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Maybe in the future, we can have this integration between JIRA Portfolio and other third-party plugins to utilize the features provide by them.
fields.summary: extending JIRA Portfolio to third-party plugins
Auto detect project when creating a subtask

fields.description:
Currently, the Portfolio dependency report shows the information "needed by"in the dependency column. 

I want to see the dependency name ("is blocked by", for example) in this column, to better understand what kind of dependency is defined there, once it is possible to create different dependency types
fields.summary: As a Portfolio administrator, I want to see the dependency name in Dependency report
Make initiatives and themes etc. available to the JIRA search or as fields that can be filtered with JQL.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1484].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Live Plans, to add an item into the backlog, you need to edit the issue source to add a single existing issue.  Previously there was an import button that allowed you to add items in easily: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Importing+existing+issues+to+the+backlog

h3. Suggested Solution
Reimplement the import button, or another way to easily add items.

h3. Workaround 
Edit the issue source to add an item into the scope in step 3 of the wizard:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Configuring+plan+settings

Alternatively if an item is removed in error and has not been committed, the change can be reverted from the uncommitted changes menu: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Committing+your+plan+changes
fields.summary: As a user I would like to import existing items to the scope or backlog with one click
Make issue status visible on parent issues
Set non-working days to delay start of sprint in Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1125].
  {panel}

I have multiple teams whose skills do not overlap. Each team has a separate JIRA project. Epics are in another JIRA project.

PROJ (Epics)
ATEAM (Stories) 
BTEAM (Stories) 
CTEAM (Stories) 

Currently whenever I want to import issues, I need to do it 4 times: Once for each team, so I can set the skill for the estimates, and before that for the Epics, so that the relationship is retained. It's a pain in the a*** and very error prone.

Also if I want to create and link issues, I have to do it 4 times. Once for each team, and once for the epic. This is another total pain.

Instead what I want is to configure relationships like this:

PROJ <––> No team, but all epics live here
ATEAM <––> "A Team" Portfolio team <––> Skills & Stages for A Team
BTEAM <––> "B Team" Portfolio team <––> Skills & Stages for B Team
CTEAM <––> "C Team" Portfolio team <––> Skills & Stages for C Team

Once that's done, I should be able to:
# Import stuff from JIRA into Portfolio in one go without having to select skills, i.e. without having to duplicate effort and rethink everything every single time.
# Create and link issues in JIRA from Portfolio without having to pick the project etc. It should be able to look at which Team I set on the story and create the issue in the corresponding project in JIRA. It should also know that all Epics go to the PROJ project.

It all comes down to these two principles: Do what reasonable users expect should work! Stop making me repeat myself everywhere!
fields.summary: Associations between Projects, Teams, Stages and Skills

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1853].
  {panel}

This should be a bug ticket, As per below document I should have ability to configure the JIRA standard fields under epic but here its not possible. for example, I can't set the hierarchy "TASK" above the epic and its not an JIRA methodology.

 

This is strange from document and real implementation problem. Please make this as BLOCKER issue and fix it.

 

Documenation:

The default hierarchy contains:
 * *Epics* - Once the higher level priorities are settled it's necessary to break them down into large pieces of work, which consist of multiple stories.
 * *Stories* - User stories capture functionality requirements.
 * *Sub-task* - Work components that make up stories.
fields.summary: Unable to set other standard issues below epic

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have Initiative burn-down and Initiative reports available on JIRA portfolio. 

Currently, JIRA portfolio provides Epic Burn-down and Epic Report to track projects, but I'd like to have reports available at the Initiative level as well.
fields.summary: Make Initiative burn-down and Initiative reports available on JIRA Portfolio

2) See that images are missing:

Regards,
Annie
fields.summary: Broken Portfolio public documentation
Visually distinguish LivePlan stories that were automatically scheduled from those with a Sprint specified
Ability to sort Shared Teams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1624].
  {panel}

h3. Motivation

As a Product Owner I want to have more control over the Roadmap generated by JIRA Portfolio 2.0 to achieve the most useful and informative results for my stakeholders.
h3. Background

The idea of generating data driven roadmaps via JIRA Portfolio 2.0 is awesome. Unfortunately the scheduler behaves "too smart" from time to time. Especially when it decides to prepone tickets that were prioritized lower for the sake of filling up sprints and to optimize capacity workload across sprints. The workaround of using dependencies is troublesome since you might end up chaining a lot of tickets to prevent JIRA Portfolio 2.0 to prepone some other tickets which is even lower in the backlog.

Also the automatic assignment of Teams to a Story or Epic is more often a burden than of help.

It's ok, that these functionalities are there. But I would love them to be optional and use only the criteria that I need.
fields.summary: Make scheduling criteria and automatic assignment of teams optional
Add links to epics, projects or tasks in releases report
